I’m trying to to CAD a belt system with multiple pulleys and several bends. I’m using Onshape, so there’s no path length dimension feature. How can I find the correct positions for the pulleys?

frcdesign.org

Belt and Pulley Basics - FRCDesign.org

A comprehensive learning guide and technical reference for FRC design using Onshape.

Frcdesign.org has a unit on belts and pulleys with it’s own belt generator so that might help to create complex belt paths

Sorry if I don’t understand, but is the variable created referenced in the actual sketch, or is it just guess and check? (In other words, instead of creating a variable, could you just use the measure tool?)

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-06-09T04:29:57.097Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":248,"readers_count":247,"score":54.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":502957,"topic_slug":"cading-complex-belts","display_username":"Calvin Selin","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":4221,"username":"Nuttyman54","name":"Nuttyman54","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nuttyman54/{size}/201522_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69303,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Design Minion/Creative Scouter"},"post_url":"/t/cading-complex-belts/502957/9","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3649421,"name":"Nuttyman54","username":"Nuttyman54","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nuttyman54/{size}/201522_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-09T04:45:25.034Z","cooked":"

It’s guess and check, the variable just automates the measurement step. As far as I know, there’s no way to create a measured variable in Onshape that can be referenced in the same sketch the measurement is taken from, due to how variables are implemented as features in the tree with parents and children.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-06-09T04:47:46.488Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":232,"readers_count":231,"score":81.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":502957,"topic_slug":"cading-complex-belts","display_username":"Nuttyman54","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":69303,"username":"Calvin-Hobbes17","name":"Calvin Selin","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/calvin-hobbes17/{size}/237325_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4221,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Design and Strategy Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/cading-complex-belts/502957/10","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3649435,"name":"Chadfrom7226","username":"Chadfrom7226","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/chadfrom7226/{size}/113429_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-09T06:34:52.974Z","cooked":"

Use circles that are the correct pitch diameter, then draw tangent lines to each circle in the chain and trim anything that isn’t the belt.

From there you just measure the length of the “belt” and that’s your length (not your teeth count)

Your (length / pitch) is your tooth count. For example, a 300mm length belt at 5mm pitch is 60t

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-06-09T06:34:52.974Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":212,"readers_count":211,"score":57.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":502957,"topic_slug":"cading-complex-belts","display_username":"Chadfrom7226","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20021,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/cading-complex-belts/502957/11","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3649570,"name":"Calvin Selin","username":"Calvin-Hobbes17","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/calvin-hobbes17/{size}/237325_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-09T15:00:41.496Z","cooked":"
